intro: Chrysosplenium dunnianum, commonly known as the mountain spleenwort, is a species of flowering plant in the family Saxifragaceae. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial that typically forms dense mats on rocky or shaded slopes. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hair, and it produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. It is native to mountainous regions of East Asia, including China and Japan. Chrysosplenium dunnianum is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories or on limestone outcrops.
